column4: Hi, i'm trying to get my wireless to work.. i need a driver for: Network controller: Atheros Communications Inc. AR9285 Wireless Network Adapter (PCI-Express) (rev 01). any ideas? have been googling all day, with no luck :(
ath9k
it comes with ubuntu
installing newer drivers wont hurt « sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-wireless-$(lsb_release -cs)-generic »
it comes in the kernel package
thanks.. that line's "done now" should i reboot for it to take effect?
yes
did not work :(
do you have a wlan0 in the « iwconfig » output?
yes
« sudo iwlist wlan0 scan » works?
« sudo ifconfig wlan0 up »
« sudo rfkill list all »
you have one blocked? hardware ? soft ?
you have to turn on the wifi in some button or key combo in your laptop
so? it works now?
finaly found it.. was because there for some reason.. is a lock key on the laptop :P
time for a facepalm or headdesk ;P
: but thanks alot anyway :P
no problem
something else or another instance of apache is using port 80
this should tell what--> sudo lsof -i :80
your nic uses r8169 driver in linux if that's what you ask
